newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-SCHUSTER MOVES INTO COACHING WITH COLOGNE JOB.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SCHUSTER MOVES INTO COACHING WITH COLOGNE JOB.

text.p: Former German international Bernd Schuster began a career as a coach on Wednesday when he took charge of second division side Fortuna Cologne.

The former Barcelona midfielder, who has been involved in controversy at almost all his previous clubs, left Mexican side UNAM in April and has been back in Germany studying for a coaching qualification.
Schuster, who won 21 caps for West Germany before quitting the national side over a dispute with his team-mates, said Fortuna had approached him at the weekend.
"I'm pretty surprised but I'm also very pleased," said Schuster, who used to play for Fortuna's big city rivals Cologne, told Wednesday's edition of the Bild newspaper.
Schuster, nicknamed the "blond angel" by the German press, played for Atletico and Real Madrid as well as Barcelona during his spell in Spain.

He last played in Germany for Bayer Leverkusen but left under a cloud last year, gaining a huge compensation payout from the club which had banned him from playing during a legal dispute between him and senior officials.
